title: Officers fees for Englishmen as they are receiued in the port of London, set downe vnder the hands for the fermors, comptrollers, collectors and searchers of the custom-house there: for a rule and president to euery custome house in any port of his Maiesties dominions, according to the table of fees, signed by the late L. Treasourer, the Earle of Dorset, and the then Barons of the Exchequer.
author: England and Wales. Commissioners of Customs.
publisher: By Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Maiestie,
notes: Pursuant to the proclamation of 12 April 1615.
Dated at end: Custome House London this second of May, 1615. W. Garway far. [and 3 others].
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
